ovdesc.p: This screen will be used to setup Inbound Code Word details for different types of incoming payments in the payments hub.
Codewords modify the message priority, set various processing indicator(Fee codeword flag, Non-STP indicator, Outbound codeword applicable flag)and execute processing sequence.
A record authorised in this screen will create or amend or delete a record in store table, PPL.INBOUND.CODEWORD
This store table helps generate processing sequence, flags and indicators for downstream payment processing in the payments hub.

desc.p: Reserved for future use. Indicates if conditional fee is applicable for the codeword. This means that the codeword influences fees calculation for the payment.
A default value of "N" is set.
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
Denotes the SWIFT information code containing the codeword.
Indicates the type of the payment message. The value will be used as one of the criteria for selection of a record of this application based on peeling logic.
Mandatory field. 10 alphanumeric characters which includes '*'.
Value links to field 'MessagePaymentType' in PPT.MSGPAYMENTTYPE
Indicates whether the code word can put a message to Non-STP processing by recording an active error in the payments hub.
Used for internal purpose. Holds the ID of the previous live record of store table.
This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters and the value is not editable by the user.
Identifies the source of the payment message.
Value links to the field, 'Source' in PPT.SOURCE
A default value of "*" is set.

Indicates whether the codeword is relevant for construction of outbound code words in messages sent out of the payments hub.Inbound codewords that are applicable for outbound are marked here but finalization of
codewords will happen in the outbound codeword processing.
A default value of "N" is set.

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.

Specifies the number associated to the particular action that is to be executed by inbound code word processing in the payments hub. The actual processing sequence is maintained separately in PPT.PROCESSINGSEQUENCE.
Value links to field 'ProcessingSequenceNumber' in PPT.PROCESSINGSEQUENCE
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.

Specifies the new/adjusted message priority value which overwrites the existing message priority value in the payment object which is an input for the product determination process. Overwrite occurs only when the message priority is not blank or 0.
The codeword received in the incoming payment message.
Specifies the codeword priority for product determination process. The

codeword with the highest priority will be considered as the 'Final Product Codeword' for the payment order. If there are multiple codewords with the same codeword priority for PD, then the 1st record is
selected and the codeword corresponding to that record is set as Final Product Codeword.

Specifies the order (sequence) of the record in the application. Based on the value, a record is prioritised in such a way that, it is given higher preference for selection under peeling logic applied in the payments hub.
Specifies the additional codes/ texts associated with the codeword.
Mandatory field. 35 alphanumeric characters including the wildcard character * is allowed
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table.
This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters and the value is not editable by the user.
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
